result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final Statement of service hours in the amount of 5.8 hours submitted by contract Attorney Frank Raff.

[MK] cases #22CM32 and #22CM149 called briefly at 2:20pm, and then at 2:26pm 
Defendant Anthony Keith Hill in court with Attorney Francis P Raff. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Hill indicates that his address is:  227 S. Main St., Apt. B.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " No Contest " is entered in Case #22CM149-Counts #1, #2, #3; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #22CM149-Counts #4 and #5, and Case #22CM32. Further the Court reads-in a referral (DA Case #22JE1383) for misdemeanor bailjumping with a date of violation of 6/7/22 and thereafter bars further prosecution of this referral. .

On Case #22CM149-Counts #1, #2, #3 each the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Hill on Probation for two years with conditions:
--to comply with any assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming per Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no contact with the Co-Defendants Richard Bauer or Michele Schacht unless approved by the Agent 
--no contact with Victim 1 unless approved by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence 
--no possession of dangerous weapons, with the exception that Mr. Hill may possess sharp objects as needed during his employment such as box-cutters and knives
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores, with the exception that Mr. Hill may be present at Fat Boyz in Fort Atkinson for work purposes or as otherwise approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs and surcharges plus court appointed attorney fees 

Days credit for time already served:  3  days 
The Court requires Mr. Hill to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by 12:00pm tomorrow.  
The Court requires Mr. Hill to report to the Jefferson Sheriff's Office for booking and DNA sample provision. 
recess 2:47pm
JAs Review of 7/12/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (7/12/22--ma)

Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Amended Bond.  Conditions of Bond include: 
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with Co-Defendants [Richard W. Bauer, Michele C Schacht] (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores, with the exception that Mr. Hill may be at Fat Boyz in Fort Atkinson in the course of his employment, during hours of employment

[MK] cases #22CM32 and #22CM149 called at 2:11pm. [along with Co-Defendant's case #22CM30-separate minutes for that case]
Defendant Anthony Keith Hill in court with Attorney Francis Raff. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Bond Modification is requested in #22CM32: 
--Attorney Raff provides information that Mr. Hill is employed as a cook at Fat Boyz in Fort Atkinson; an exception is requested to the Bond condition that prohibits presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores.
--the Court amends the subject Bond condition to allow an exception that Mr. Hill may be at Fat Boyz in Fort Atkinson in the course of his employment, during hours of employment  

Initial Appearance is held in Case #22CM149:
--the Court appoints Attorney Raff as counsel 
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
--Pleas of  "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived by both parties 
--The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.
--The Court continues the  $650 Cash Bond (already posted) , with added conditions: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no contact with Victim 1 as identified in the Victim Witness Key 
Mr. Hill provides an updated address: 227 S. Main St., Apt. B in Fort Atkinson. 
recess 2:19pm 

NEXT:  (1) appointment of Attorney Raff as counsel in case #22CM149, (2) Pretrial Conference on July 20th at 8:30am,  (3) Status Conference on July 28th at 2:00pm

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Keith Hill
Current: 227 S. Main St., Apt. B, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538   (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: 114 S 5th Street, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

[ae] cases 22CM31 and 22CM32 called 10:50 AM Defendant Richard W Bauer in court with attorney Karl E Huebner. Defendant Anthony Keith Hill in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


As to 22CM31: The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with co-defendants
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)
